description: From Ottoman Turkish عمارت‎ (imaret), from Arabic عِمَارَة‎ (ʕimāra).

entries.meaning: (historical or architecture) An Ottoman soup kitchen built between the fourteenth and nineteenth centuries, often part of a larger complex or waqf.
examples: Ytldtnm Bayezid had located his imaret in the opposite direction, some two kilometers to the east of the city. Mehmed I chose a site closer to the center, between the imarets of Orhan Gazi and Ytldtnm Bayezid.
